components.description:
Firework emoji, showing a explosion of colored light in the night sky, used for any number of celebrations such as New Year's Eve.

Colors vary by platform, and may include pink, purple, yellow, blue, and green.
components.title: Fireworks

description:
Firework emoji, showing a explosion of colored light in the night sky, used for any number of celebrations such as New Year's Eve.

Colors vary by platform, and may include pink, purple, yellow, blue, and green.
title: Fireworks

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Celebration symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Firework emoji, showing a explosion of colored light in the night sky, used for any number of celebrations such as New Year's Eve. Colors va http://emojipedia.org/fireworks/
emoji_net_data.name: fireworks

bn:00103623a: As if shining with a brilliant light; radiant.

bn:13689766a: Pertaining to a feast or feast-day. (Now only as the noun used attributively.)

bn:00098857a: Emitting or reflecting light readily or in large amounts

bn:00084714v: To behave as expected during holidays or rites.
Behave as expected during of holidays or rites
To honour by rites, by ceremonies of joy and respect, or by refraining from ordinary business; to observe duly; to keep.

bn:00093621v: Shine with a weak or fitful light

bn:00073964n: Sphere of plasma held together by gravity, undergoing fusion
A luminous celestial body that is made from gases (particularly hydrogen and helium) and forms the shape of a sphere.
This article is for quotes about stars, or which make prominent mention of stars.
(astronomy) a celestial body of hot gases that radiates energy derived from thermonuclear reactions in the interior
A star is a massive, luminous sphere of plasma held together by its own gravity.
A luminous celestial body, made up of plasma (particularly hydrogen and helium) and having a spherical shape. Depending on context the sun may or may not be included.

bn:00016139n: Festive season which occurs immediately before Lent
A festive season which occurs immediately before Lent.
A festival marked by merrymaking and processions
Carnival is a festive season which occurs immediately before Lent; the main events are usually during February.
A festive occasion marked by parades and sometimes special foods and other entertainment.

bn:03895160n: In astronomy, starburst is a generic term to describe a region of space with an abnormally high rate of star formation.
A region of space with an unusually high rate of star formation.
A generic term to describe a region of space with a much higher than normal star formation

bn:00009919n: A steady bright blue light; formerly used as a signal but now a firework
A bright blue flare, formerly used in signalling, but now chiefly as fireworks.
Fireworks are a class of explosive pyrotechnic devices used for aesthetic, cultural, and religious purposes.
Such as firecrackers, bottle rockets, bang snaps and others
An event or a display where fireworks are set off.

bn:00021834n: An expression of approval and commendation
Expressing praise and approval, expressing approbation.
An expression of approval and commendation.
